meanings.definition: Make a long, high-pitched cry or noise.
meanings.sent1: The excited puppy squealed with joy when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent2: The little girl squealed in delight when she saw the colorful balloons.
meanings.sent3: The mouse squealed as it ran across the kitchen floor, surprising the cat.
meanings.sent4: The kettle on the stove squealed loudly as the water inside boiled rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The brakes of the car squealed as the driver made a sudden stop to avoid a collision.

meanings.sent1: She squealed on her friend by telling the teacher about the secret plan.
meanings.sent2: The spy squealed to the enemy about the upcoming military operation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot squealed the hidden password to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The traitor squealed the confidential details to the rival organization.
meanings.sent5: The witness squealed in court, revealing the truth about the crime.

meanings.sent1: The teapot squealed as steam escaped from its spout.
meanings.sent2: The excited children squealed with glee as they rode the roller coaster.
meanings.sent3: The rusty door hinge squealed loudly every time it was opened.
meanings.sent4: The violinist's bow squealed against the strings during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The tires of the bicycle squealed on the wet pavement as the rider braked suddenly.
